concept.title: 243.204-70-4 Limitations on obligations.

conbody.p:
(a) The Government shall not obligate more than 50 percent of the not-to-exceed price before definitization. However, if a contractor submits a qualifying proposal before 50 percent of the not-to-exceed price has been obligated by the Government, the limitation on obligations before definitization may be increased to no more than 75 percent (see
for coverage on provisional delivery payments).
(b) Obligations should be consistent with the contractorâ€™s requirements for the undefinitized period.
